Detailed Description

The environment variable values are automatically cached so that subsequent calls to get their value is each time the same. To be sure the value is up to date before getting the value, one must call the update() method. Setting a new value is performing a write through the cache.

CAUTION: This class is not thread safe yet! An instance should never be used across multiple threads. If one day the need arises, this class could be modified to handle multi-threading.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DepthSense::Utils::EnvironmentVariable::EnvironmentVariable ( std::string  name)

Construct an environment variable instance, with an non initialized cached value.

Parameters
nameThe environment variable name.

Member Function Documentation

int DepthSense::Utils::EnvironmentVariable::getIntValue ( )

Get the cached value of the environment variable as an int. If no value is yet cached, this function automatically update() it first. If a conversion error occurs, an exception is thrown.

Returns
the cached value as an int.
Exceptions
EnvironmentVariable::ConversionExceptionthe environment variable value could not be converted to an integer.
int DepthSense::Utils::EnvironmentVariable::getIntValue ( int  defaultValue)
throw (
)

Get the cached value of the environment variable as an int. If no value is yet cached, this function automatically update() it first. If a conversion error occurs, non exception is thrown, and the default value is returned.

Parameters
defaultValueA default value that will be returned if the conversion failed.
Returns
the cached value as an int, or the default value if the environment variable value could not be converted to an integer.
const char* DepthSense::Utils::EnvironmentVariable::getValue ( )
throw (
)

Get the cached value of the environment variable as a const char* string. If no value is yet cached, this function automatically update() it first.

Returns
the cached value as a const char* string.
bool DepthSense::Utils::EnvironmentVariable::isDefined ( )
throw (
)

Check whether the environment variable is defined and not empty. If no value is yet cached, this function automatically update() it first.

Returns
true if the environment variable is defined and not empty, false otherwise.
void DepthSense::Utils::EnvironmentVariable::setValue ( const char *  value)
throw (
)

Set the environment variable using a const char* string. The cached value is updated as well as the environment variable.

Parameters
valueThe value to be assigned to the environment variable.
